Comment: And then there are the ripple effects that keep branching out. Two countries that might have never traded with each other hit by tariffs might look at each other and think, "Hey I was buying this from them? Can I buy it from you?" And then it becomes business that will never come back to the US even after tariffs end.   And then further ripples. Businesses and countries might decide to skip investing in the US entirely out of fear of a tariff popping up on random thursdays or fridays that might put them out of business.   Then even further out there are going to be kids growing up right now where the US is attacking them in a trade war, or threatening to annex them. Those kids will grow up as a new generation that is highly skeptical of the US.   This is going to hurt the US for generations. I am sure Putin could not be more proud of Trump.
